COPY NO,cp. 219 (38). t0 A B I N E T-DEFENCE PREPARATIONS - MEASURES OF ACCELERATION.Memorandum by the Minister for Co-ordinationof Defence",I think that my colleagues should be aware of the steps which are being taken to deal with this all-important matter,,-2, At the 333rd Meeting of the Committee of Imperial Defence, held on the 6th October, it was agreed:(a) That all Departments concerned should carry out forthwith a review of the military and civil defence measures taken during the recent crisis, and should submit a report thereon as soon as possible (and in any event not later than the 31st October) to the Secretary, Committee of Imperial Defence, for consideration by the Minister for Co-ordination of Defence,(b) That the above reports should -(i) point out any defects in existing arrangements which were.disclosed during the crisis; and(ii) make suggestions for remedying these defects,,(c) That the Minister for Co-ordination of Defence should consult with the other Ministers concerned in regard to the procedure for dealing with the reports,4 (d) In addition to the above review of theparticular defence measures taken during the crisis, to invite the Minister for Co-ordination of Defence to consult with the Ministers concerned in regard to any changes in defence policy which are now considered necessary* 3o Subsequent to this Meeting, a number of Questions have been put down for answer in the House of ^Commons on the 1st November, on which this review has a direct bearing, and Departments have accordingly been invited to advance the date of submission of the reports from the 31st to the 25th October.4c On the 6th October, after informal discussion with the members of the Board of Admiralty,the Army Council and the Air Council responsible for supply matters, I invited the three Service departments to submit by the 18th October statements showing thefollowing particulars:-(i) To what extent the approved programmes would have been completed by the 1st August, 1939, giving details under a number of heads:(ii) What steps could be taken to improve the above position by the 1st August, 1939, or shortly thereafter, and what those steps would involve.5o As soon as these reports have beenreceived I propose to consider the matter further with the Service Ministers, with a view to submittingdefinite proposals at an early date as to the steps to be taken to accelerate our defence preparations.(Intldo) T.W.H.I.Richmond Terrace, S.W.lc, 13th October, 1938,
